Happy Trails…time to get out there!

Hiking, biking, or just enjoying one of our natural parks. ‘Tis the season to get out there!

Every year, the American Hiking Society organizes and coordinates National Trails Day (NTD), a celebration of America’s outstanding Trail System. This year, the celebration falls on June 4th.  Local communities can host events, such as a run for the woods, hiking experiences, stewardship projects, bird watching expeditions, trail biking journeys, geocaching, and much more.  What kinds of adventures are you planning for NTD?  Click here to find events close to you.

This August also marks the centennial of the National Park Service (NPS), and everyone can take part in the celebration!

Find your favorite park, use this guide book, grab some birthday cake, and enjoy your adventure! The Find Your Park project is a joint effort between the National Park Service and the National Park Foundation. Park visitors are encouraged to visit the National Parks both in person as well as online. Fun fact: the first National Park was Yellowstone, created in 1872.

Around Town

Be a Boston historic guru – walk-about the city with Boston’s Freedom Trail guide book or Boston: A Historic Walking Tour.

Looking to walk around Brookline? Consider grabbing a copy of Exploring the Paths of Brookline.

For hiking in Massachusetts or in other portions of New England, grab 60 Hikes Within 60 Miles: Boston: Including Coastal and Interior Regions, and New Hampshire or the Hiking Acadia National Park guide book.

We have tons of hiking and biking maps for you, from companies such as, National Geographic, Rubel, and the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC).  If there’s a map you don’t see on our shelves, we’re happy to get it for you.  The ordering timeline is generally a week or so.  For questions about map orders, please email our map specialist, Shuchi!

Are you a biking enthusiast?  Can’t wait to get out on the biking trails?  Consider the following books and maps which offer clear, concise, and off-the-beaten path routes just for you:  Best Bike Rides Boston or our great collections of Rubel bike maps. And, the Booksmith is a proud supporter of Bicycle Benefits!

There are so many reasons to get outdoors this June!
